author: kfogel
msg: Adjust to reflect removal of clients/ directory in revision 6880.
This is an empty revision for padding.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/svndumpfilter/main.c
(new_node_record): Support copy-and-modify from filtered sources (as
add-without-history).

author: cmpilato
msg: Make svndumpfilter basically clean out the revision properties for
revisions that exist only as padding so that revision numbers don't
get skewed.  Add an option --preserve-revprops to revert to the old
behavior.
* subversion/svndumpfilter/main.c
(struct parse_baton_t): Add 'preserve_revprops' member.
(svndumpfilter__preserve_revprops): New.
(options_table): Add new --preserve-revprops option.
(cmd_table): Make 'include' and 'exclude' accept the new option.
(struct svndumpfilter_opt_state): Add 'preserve_revprops'.
(struct revision_baton_t): Make props an apr_hash_t *.
(new_revision_record): Don't start building the revision props
string just yet.  Just make a hash to store the buggers in.
(set_revision_property): Eh eh!  No flattening of the property
here.  Just toss the value into the props hash.
(close_revision): Do the property hash -> stringbuf conversion here,
and (now for the real reason behind this code churn) trim the
properties for empty revisions left only because
we weren't told to drop empty revisions to just the revision's
date and a log message indicating that this revision is just
stuffing (unless we were told not to do this).
(parse_baton_initialize): Add new option value to the parse baton.
(main): Parse new option.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_repos/dump.c
(dump_node): Remove leading slashes from node paths.  C-Mike can't
deal with dumpfiles that have mixed representations.  Drives him
crazy, and all that.
